q01.title: Overall readiness right now
q01.prompt: As honestly as you can, where are you today?

options.label: Not ready (dating would likely make life harder for me or the other person right now)
Mostly not ready (I need focused prep first)
Cautiously ready (I can date lightly while working on myself)
Ready (stable, accountable, and able to date with integrity)

examples: Not ready (e.g., I don't feel the capacity for a relationship right now).
Mostly not ready (e.g., I want to date, but have other major priorities first).
Cautiously ready (e.g., I'm open to meeting people but taking it slow).
Ready (e.g., I feel stable and excited to connect).
Unsure (e.g., I swing between wanting connection and wanting space).

q02.title: Why now?
q02.prompt: What is pulling you toward dating right now? Select all that apply, then drag to rank by priority (top = your main driver today).

options.label: I desire marriage/family and feel timing matters
I want to build a values-based relationship intentionally
I feel emotionally ready and want to grow through real connection
I want to practice healthy connection after a hard chapter
I feel lonely and want relief
I miss physical affection and closeness
A life change made dating feel relevant again (move, new job, kids, etc.)
Validation or proving something (to self or someone else)

fields.label: How urgent does dating feel right now? (0-10)
How confident are you that this is a healthy time to date? (0-10)
Anything else to add (1-3 sentences)
fields.placeholder: Optional context. What changed recently, if anything?

examples: Reasons ranked: 1) I want companionship and partnership, 2) I want to build a values-based relationship intentionally, 3) I feel emotionally ready and want to grow through real connection.
How urgent does dating feel right now? (0-10): 4.
How confident are you that this is a healthy time to date? (0-10): 7.
Notes: I want to date intentionally and slowly, without rushing big decisions.

q03.title: Current emotional baseline
q03.prompt: Most days in the last 2 weeks, your baseline mood has been:
examples: Stable/neutral (e.g., okay, just going through the routine).
Variable (e.g., lots of ups and downs recently).
Low (e.g., feeling down or drained often).
Anxious (e.g., feeling worried or on edge).

q04.title: Stress load
q04.prompt: Right now, how overloaded is your life?
examples: Moderate (e.g., busy but I'm handling it).
Heavy (e.g., under significant pressure right now).

q05.title: Capacity for mutual responsibility
q05.prompt: When dating, can you reliably show up (time, attention, emotional presence) without neglecting key responsibilities?
examples: Yes, consistently (e.g., I follow through on what I say).
Mostly (e.g., I usually come through, with occasional slips).
Inconsistent (e.g., I struggle to keep commitments).
No (e.g., I can't take on responsibility for another right now).

q06.title: Active crisis / safety check
q06.prompt: In the last 6 months, have you had thoughts of self-harm or suicide?
examples: Passive (e.g., occasional dark thoughts but no intent).
Active (Please prioritize your safety and seek professional support).

q07.title: Substance stability
q07.prompt: In the last 3 months, your relationship with alcohol/drugs has been:

options.label: Currently a concern (I should address it before dating)

examples: Occasional/Responsible (e.g., social use that doesn't impact my life).
Sometimes problematic (e.g., I sometimes overdo it).

q08.title: Integrity with sexuality
q08.prompt: Right now, are you living in a way that you feel is aligned with your values around sexual integrity?

options.label: Actively working on it with support

examples: Yes (e.g., my behavior aligns with my values).
Mostly (e.g., minor struggles but mostly aligned).
No (e.g., I feel out of control or misaligned).
Working on it (e.g., taking steps to improve).

q09.title: Top 3 reasons you might not be ready
q09.prompt: Select and rank the top 3 things that could make dating confusing, heavy, or unkind to you or to another person right now. Drag to reorder by importance (top = most significant).

fields.label: Select and rank your top 3 (top = most significant)

options.label: Still thinking about my ex frequently
Dating from loneliness rather than readiness

fields.label: Any context you want to add
fields.placeholder: Optional: explain why these are your top concerns...

examples: Top reasons ranked: 1) Financial stress or instability, 2) Emotional instability (mood swings, anxiety, depression), 3) Trouble setting or respecting boundaries.
Top reasons ranked: 1) Unhealed trauma affecting relationships, 2) Trust issues (giving or receiving), 3) Poor communication skills.

q10.title: Relationship timeline
q10.prompt: Provide a quick timeline snapshot (estimates are fine).

fields.label: Months since last major relationship ended
Your estimate of your average relationship length (months)
How many major relationships have you had?

examples: Months since last major relationship ended: 24. Length of last major relationship (months): 12. Length of longest relationship (months): 18. Your estimate of your average relationship length (months): 10. How many major relationships have you had?: 3.

Months since last major relationship ended: 6. Length of last major relationship (months): 3. Length of longest relationship (months): 24. Your estimate of your average relationship length (months): 8. How many major relationships have you had?: 4.

q12.title: Emotional closure with your ex
q12.prompt: When you think about your most recent ex/partner, what is the dominant emotional charge?
examples: Neutral (e.g., I don't think about them much).
Warm (e.g., we wish each other well).
Mixed (e.g., some good days, some hard days).

q13.title: Contact with ex
q13.prompt: Is your ex still in your life? (Any contact counts.)

options.label: Emotionally intimate / confiding in each other

examples: Frequent (e.g., we are still close friends).

q14.title: Ex-boundaries and readiness impact
q14.prompt: If there is any ongoing ex-contact, how clean are your boundaries?

options.label: Very clean (clear purpose, no emotional leakage)

fields.label: If not 'very clean', what would need to change before you date seriously?

examples: Very clean (clear purpose, no emotional leakage): boundaries are clear and respected.
Mostly clean (minor leakage sometimes): occasional blurred moments, but mostly okay.
Messy (blurred lines): lines are often crossed or emotionally confusing.
Harmful/unsafe: contact or dynamics feel unsafe or destabilizing.

q15.title: Unfinished business
q15.prompt: Do you feel you have any 'unfinished business' with your last relationship (closure talks, apologies, finances, legal, spiritual)?
examples: Major (e.g., still living together or financially tied).

q16.title: Relational safety check
q16.prompt: Right now, do you feel physically and emotionally safe from harassment, threats, or control by a current partner, ex, or anyone you are dating?

options.label: Mostly (some concerns, but I do not feel afraid)
No (I feel unsafe, pressured, stalked, threatened, or afraid)

q17.title: How relationships typically end for you
q17.prompt: Historically, your relationships most often end because:

q18.title: What did you learn from your last relationship?
q18.prompt: Name 2-5 lessons you want to carry forward (skills, boundaries, patterns to avoid).
examples: I learned that I need to speak up sooner.
I learned that shared values are critical.
I learned to trust my intuition.

q19.title: What would your ex say was hard about being with you?
q19.prompt: Be honest. If you don't know, guess what they would say.
examples: They might say I work too much.
They might say I struggle to open up.
They might say I can be critical.

q20.title: Therapy/coaching readiness
q20.prompt: Are you currently in therapy/coaching, or open to it if needed?
examples: Open (e.g., willing to go if needed).
Not open (e.g., prefer to handle things myself).

q21.title: Medication stability (if applicable)
q21.prompt: If you take mental health medication, your situation is:
examples: Adjusting (e.g., currently finding the right balance).

q22.title: Emotional regulation under stress

options.label: Need space, then return to resolve

examples: Need space (e.g., take a walk, then return).
Pursue (e.g., want to fix it immediately).

q23.title: Common dysregulation behaviors
q23.prompt: When you are dysregulated, which show up for you? (Select all that apply.)

options.label: None of these are common for me

q24.title: Sleep consistency
examples: Somewhat inconsistent (e.g., varies weekends vs weekdays).
Poor (e.g., frequent waking or trouble sleeping).

q25.title: Anger and aggression risk
q25.prompt: In the last year, have you yelled, threatened, intimidated, or thrown/broken things in conflict with a partner?
examples: Yes, multiple times (e.g., has happened before).

q26.title: Pornography/compulsive sexual behavior impact
q26.prompt: Does pornography or compulsive sexual behavior currently affect your ability to date with integrity?
examples: Severe impact (e.g., feels out of control).
In recovery (e.g., active in a program).

q27.title: Support system
q27.prompt: Name the 1-3 people (or supports) you would lean on if dating triggered anxiety, old wounds, or temptation.
examples: Examples: Therapist, Best friend, Mentor, Sibilng.
Examples: Support group leader, Parent, Trusted colleague.

q28.title: Emotional availability
q28.prompt: If someone you like gets closer emotionally, your most common response is:
examples: Test (e.g., check if they are serious).
Overgive (e.g., try to earn their affection).

q29.title: Attachment style (self-estimate)
q29.prompt: Which description fits you best in relationships?

options.label: Mostly secure (comfortable with closeness and independence)
More anxious (worry, reassurance-seeking, fear of abandonment)
More avoidant (value space, feel engulfed, shut down under pressure)
Mixed/fearful (want closeness but also fear it)

examples: Secure (e.g., comfortable with intimacy and independence).
Fearful/Mixed (e.g., want closeness but fear it).

q30.title: Repair skill
q30.prompt: After conflict, you can usually repair (apologize, own impact, reconnect) within:

options.label: Depends heavily on the other person

examples: Week (e.g., takes a while to reconnect).
Rarely (e.g., we often don't resolve it).

q31.title: Conflict style
q31.prompt: In conflict, you tend to do: (Select all that apply.)
examples: Argue to win (e.g., focusing on accuracy).

q32.title: Honesty under pressure
q32.prompt: When you fear losing someone, you are most likely to:

options.label: Stay honest even if it risks the relationship
Manage my image / hide parts of myself
Detach and act like I don't care

examples: Stay honest (e.g., speak truth despite fear).
Detach (e.g., acting like I don't care).

q33.title: Boundaries skill
q33.prompt: Your ability to set and hold boundaries is:

options.label: Okay (I can do it but its uncomfortable)

examples: Okay (e.g., I can do it but it's hard).
Unsure (e.g., not sure where my lines are).

q34.title: Patterns you repeat
q34.prompt: Select and rank the patterns you most want to stop repeating in relationships. Drag to reorder by priority (top = most important to change).

fields.label: Select and rank patterns to work on (top = highest priority)

options.label: Moving too fast emotionally or physically
Ignoring red flags or gut feelings
Shutting down when hurt instead of talking
Staying too long in bad situations

fields.label: Context about your top pattern
fields.placeholder: Optional: what does this pattern look like for you specifically?

examples: Top patterns ranked: 1) Over-giving / people-pleasing to earn love, 2) Ignoring red flags or gut feelings, 3) Moving too fast emotionally or physically.
Top patterns ranked: 1) Avoiding conflict or hard conversations, 2) Shutting down when hurt instead of talking, 3) Leaving at first difficulty.

q35.title: Trust calibration
q35.prompt: If someone is slow to text back early on, you usually interpret it as:

options.label: I text more to get clarity

examples: Mild worry (e.g., notice it but stay calm).
Text more (e.g., try to get a response).

q36.title: Faith and spirituality profile
q36.prompt: If faith or spirituality matters to you (even a little), what does it look like right now? If it does not, that is okay too.
examples: Importance: Central. Tradition: Christian. Community: Active.
Importance: Important. Tradition: LDS. Community: Occasional.

fields.label: In your life right now, faith/spirituality is

options.label: Not part of my life right now

fields.label: My current spiritual tradition/background is closest to
Participation in a faith/spiritual community is currently
If you are LDS: temple recommend status
Anything you want noted (optional)
fields.placeholder: e.g., beliefs that matter for dating, healing journey, interfaith considerations

q37.title: Faith-based commitments and alignment (if any)
q37.prompt: If your faith/spirituality includes commitments or standards that affect dating (e.g., abstinence, worship, marriage intent, interfaith boundaries), how clear and steady are you with them?

options.label: Clear and aligned (I can live what I believe)
Not clear yet (still sorting it out)

fields.label: If you want, name 1-3 commitments you hope to keep (optional)
fields.placeholder: e.g., no sex, no cohabitation, worship weekly, avoid interfaith mismatch

fields.label: Support that helps you live aligned (optional)
fields.placeholder: e.g., accountability partner, therapist, faith leader, routines

q38.title: Commitment goal and direction
q38.prompt: What are you dating toward right now? (It is okay if your answer is 'not sure'.)

options.label: Committed relationship (not sure about marriage yet)
I am not ready to date seriously

fields.label: If your faith includes covenant/sacred marriage (e.g., temple sealing), it is

q39.title: Lifestyle integrity
q39.prompt: Which best describes your alignment with your core values day-to-day?
examples: Repairing (e.g., working to get back on track).

q40.title: Non-negotiables (values)
q40.prompt: Select and rank up to 5 non-negotiables for a future relationship. Drag to reorder by priority (top = most important).

fields.label: Select and rank your non-negotiables (top = highest priority)
Any context about your priorities
fields.placeholder: Optional: why are these your top priorities?

examples: Top 5: 1) Faith, 2) Kindness, 3) Communication, 4) Finances, 5) Family.
Top 5: 1) Integrity, 2) Humor, 3) Stability, 4) Chemistry, 5) Growth.

q41.title: Dealbreakers you might be tempted to ignore
q41.prompt: Name 1-3 dealbreakers you have ignored in the past (and why).
examples: Ignored values mismatch because chemistry was strong.
Ignored financial chaos because they were fun.
Ignored lack of ambition because they were kind.

q42.title: Dating intention in the next 90 days
q42.prompt: In the next 90 days, you are aiming for:

options.label: Serious and fast (focused on marriage soon)

q43.title: Multi-dating vs focusing
q43.prompt: How do you prefer to date early on?

fields.label: In the first 1-3 dates, I prefer to

options.label: Date one person at a time
Date a few people casually (honest about it)

fields.label: If dating multiple, what's your comfortable max at once?
Notes (optional)
fields.placeholder: Anything about pacing, honesty, or expectations.

examples: Early: Date a few casually. Max: 3.

q45.title: Communication pace early on
q45.prompt: In early dating, you prefer communication to be:

options.label: Minimal until we know its a fit

q46.title: Physical boundaries (high-level)
q46.prompt: Before commitment, your physical boundaries are best described as:

options.label: Unclear / I need to define this

q47.title: Boundary risk management
q47.prompt: What helps you keep boundaries and integrity when attraction is high?

fields.label: My risk of crossing my own boundaries is
Supports I will use (select all that apply)
One change I commit to (specific)
fields.placeholder: Example: 'No private late-night hangouts in the first month.'

q48.title: What you are looking for (trait focus)
q48.prompt: Right now, you are most attracted to:

q50.title: Co-parenting quality (if applicable)
q50.prompt: If you co-parent (or have an ex tied to your parenting), what is the current state?

fields.label: Impact on dating (optional)
fields.placeholder: How does this affect your time, stress, or emotional bandwidth?

examples: State: Tense. Impact: requires scheduling flexibility.
State: High conflict. Impact: significant stress.

q51.title: Time availability
q51.prompt: Realistically, you can date (quality time) about:

q53.title: Work and schedule predictability
examples: Somewhat predictable (e.g., shifts vary but known).

q54.title: Health constraints
q54.prompt: Do you have any major health constraints that would significantly affect dating/relationships right now?
examples: Yes, managed (e.g., chronic condition that is under control).
Yes, unmanaged (e.g., health is a major challenge right now).

q55.title: Non-negotiable logistics
q55.prompt: List any hard constraints (distance, relocation, work shifts, kids schedules, legal constraints).
examples: Constraints: Cannot relocate due to work.

q56.title: Accountability
q56.prompt: If this questionnaire surfaces a weakness, you will most likely:

options.label: Think about it but delay action

examples: Act (e.g., make a plan to address it).
Think (e.g., reflect on it but wait to act).
Defend (e.g., feel the need to explain it).
Avoid (e.g., try not to focus on it).

q57.title: Feedback preferences
q57.prompt: How do you handle feedback best?

fields.label: What makes feedback hard for you? (optional)

q58.title: Top growth areas
q58.prompt: Select and rank (up to 5) the areas you want to strengthen before/while dating. Drag to reorder by priority (top = highest priority).

fields.label: Select and rank your growth priorities (top = highest priority)
Why these are your top priorities
fields.placeholder: Optional: what's driving these growth priorities?

examples: Top 5: 1) Emotional regulation, 2) Boundaries, 3) Communication, 4) Self-worth, 5) Life stability.
Top 5: 1) Spiritual practice, 2) Conflict repair, 3) Health, 4) Social skills, 5) Closure.

q59.title: Your 4-week preparation commitment
q59.prompt: Write a 4-week plan: 1-3 actions you will take, with dates. Make it specific.
examples: Plan: Read one book on attachment, Journal weekly.
Plan: Join a social group, Discuss goals with a mentor.

q60.title: What should a therapist/AI know upfront?
q60.prompt: If you share this with a therapist or AI coach, what context do you want them to know to avoid misreading you?
examples: I need time to open up.

q61.title: Primary dating pattern historically

options.label: Serial monogamy (one relationship to next quickly)

examples: Serial monogamy (e.g., jumping from one to next).

q62.title: Speed of emotional bonding
examples: Slowly (e.g., takes time to build feelings).

q63.title: Anxiety and depression impact
q63.prompt: In the last 6 months, anxiety or depression has impacted your daily functioning:

q64.title: Trauma awareness
q64.prompt: Do you have known trauma history that could be activated in relationships?

q65.title: Your main triggers and soothing
q65.prompt: List 1-5 relationship triggers and what reliably helps you regulate.
examples: Triggers: Yelling, Silence. Soothing: Walking away, Music.
Triggers: Criticism, Lateness. Soothing: Reassurance, Space.

q66.title: Communication default
examples: Avoidant (e.g., stay silent to keep peace).
Overexplain (e.g., talk a lot to clarify).

q68.title: Honesty about needs
q68.prompt: How comfortable are you asking directly for what you need (affection, clarity, time, reassurance)?

q69.title: Your apology profile
q69.prompt: When you apologize, what do you tend to do well, and what do you tend to miss?
examples: Well: Owning it. Miss: Changing behavior.

q70.title: Spiritual practices that nourish you (if any)
q70.prompt: If you have personal practices that help you stay grounded (spiritual or reflective), which are in your life right now?

options.label: Therapy/coaching as part of my inner work

q71.title: Sexual boundaries in dating (high-level)
q71.prompt: Right now, your expectation for sexual boundaries while dating is:

options.label: Abstinence with some gray zones I need to define

examples: Abstinence with some gray zones I need to define: some affection is okay, but I want clear limits.
Still discerning / not sure: I am still deciding what I believe and what I will hold.
Other (write in): I will explain my boundaries clearly.

q72.title: Faith-related dealbreakers (if any)
examples: Dealbreakers: Different faith, Hostility to religion.

q73.title: Early exclusivity pressure
q73.prompt: If someone pushes for exclusivity very fast, you tend to:

q74.title: Early physical escalation pressure
q74.prompt: If someone pushes for physical escalation beyond your comfort, you tend to:

q75.title: What you want to be different this time
q75.prompt: Select up to 6 things you want to do differently in dating this time.

q76.title: Relocation openness
q76.prompt: Are you open to relocating for the right relationship?

q77.title: Debt and obligations
examples: Moderate (e.g., some debt but paying it).

q78.title: Your realistic weekly rhythm
q78.prompt: Describe your normal weekly rhythm (work, church, kids, gym, downtime) and where dating fits.
examples: Rhythm: Kids week on/off, varying availability.

q79.title: Openness to difficult conversations
q79.prompt: How willing are you to have difficult conversations early (values, boundaries, timelines, kids, faith)?
examples: Willing (e.g., will do it if needed).

q80.title: Your personal green flags
q80.prompt: List 5 green flags about you that you bring to a relationship (character, skills, stability, faith, service).
examples: Green flags: Loyal, Stable, Kind, Honest.

q81.title: Your personal red flags
q81.prompt: List 1-5 red flags you need to be honest about (patterns, temptations, avoidance, anger, secrecy).

q82.title: Your 'ready to date' rules
q82.prompt: Write 3 rules that define what 'ready' means for you (behavior-based, measurable).
examples: Rules: Honest about feelings, Support system in place, Not rushing.
Rules: Past relationship fully closed, Emotional availability.

lite.title: Lite
lite.post_timebox_activity: Pick your top 3 growth areas and write a 4-week plan with one concrete weekly action per area.

full.title: Full
full.post_timebox_activity: Review your answers with a trusted mentor/therapist and turn them into a preparation plan with deadlines and accountability.
